radiographic_examinations.findings: Baseline cortisol, 38 nmol/L; 30-minute level, 480 nmol/L; peak attained at 60 minutes, 580 nmol/L; ACTH level was in normal range at 7.4 pmol/L.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At 8 months of age, a second short Synacthen test was undertaken; peak cortisol level of 130 nmol/L was attained at 60 minutes, consistent with adrenal insufficiency.
